author: Melissa Williams
description: Slow cooker Hawaiian meatballs are made with frozen meatballs, canned pineapple, peppers, onions, and a sweet and tangy sauce. This dump-and-go crockpot recipe makes the perfect appetizer or a main dish that the whole family will love!

ingredients: 3 pounds frozen meatballs (beef, pork, turkey, plant based)
¼ cup low sodium soy sauce
3 pounds frozen meatballs (beef, pork, turkey, plant based)
¼ cup low sodium soy sauce
instructions:
Pour the frozen meatballs, pineapple chunks, peppers and onions into the basin of a 6-8 quart slow cooker.
In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the barbecue sauce, soy sauce, vinegar, brown sugar, and minced garlic.
Pour the sauce over the meatballs and gently stir to evenly distribute.
Cover and cook on HIGH for 2-3 hours.
Garnish with chopped scallions.
instructions_list: Pour the frozen meatballs, pineapple chunks, peppers and onions into the basin of a 6-8 quart slow cooker.
In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the barbecue sauce, soy sauce, vinegar, brown sugar, and minced garlic.
Pour the sauce over the meatballs and gently stir to evenly distribute.
Cover and cook on HIGH for 2-3 hours.
title: Easy Slow Cooker Hawaiian Meatballs
